plurals.description: Plural form content description for number of new notifications [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
plurals.name: mtrl_badge_content_description

resources.string: Adapt to how you hold the device

string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to expand a bottomsheet halfway to its full height. [CHAR LIMIT=25]
string.name: bottomsheet_action_expand_halfway

resources.string: An external braille display is connected, which you can use to type text into this device.\nOr, you can switch to the touch-screen Braille Keyboard or the next input method.
There is no other keyboard enabled, go to keyboard settings
Couldnt update dot position. Touch and hold the screen with 6 fingers. Then try again.
Updating dot position. First, lets record the dots on your left hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your left hand.
Updating dot position. First, lets record the dots on your right hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your right hand.
Updated positions for dots 1, 2, and 3. Next, lets record the dots on your left hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your left hand.
Updated positions for dots 1, 2, and 3. Next, lets record the dots on your right hand. Touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of your right hand.
%1$s won\'t work unless you enable Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device.
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device.
%1$s won\'t run unless you update Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are currently updating.
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Showing braille keyboard. Turn your phone so the screen is facing away from you. Rotate the phone horizontally to landscape position. Then start typing.
To add a space, swipe right
To delete a word, swipe left with 2 fingers
To hide the keyboard, swipe down with 2 fingers
To move the cursor backward, swipe up
To move the cursor forward, swipe down
For a new line, swipe right with 2 fingers
To switch to the next keyboard, swipe down with 3 fingers
For help and other options, swipe up with 3 fingers
To submit text, swipe up with 2 fingers
%s\nPlace your device flat on a table. Then, touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of each hand in a position thats comfortable for you to type.
You wont be able to use regular TalkBack gestures in the braille keyboard.\n\nTo get started, lets set up the position of the 6 braille dots when you type.
Place your device flat on a table. Then, touch and hold the screen with the middle 3 fingers of each hand in a position thats comfortable for you to type.

string.description: Content description for an icon that appears in the title area of a dialog
string.name: icon_content_description

resources.string: TalkBack braille keyboard - for help, visit g.co/help/braille
To move the cursor forward, swipe down
To hide keyboard, swipe down with 2 fingers
To switch to your other keyboard, swipe down with 3 fingers
To delete a letter, swipe left
To add a space, swipe right
To move the cursor backward, swipe up
To finish tutorial, swipe up with 3 fingers
Tap dot 1 with your left index finger to type the letter "A"
Next, try typing the letters B, C, and D
Press key combination with %1$s modifier key to set new shortcut.
Press key combination to set new shortcut. It must contain at least ALT or Control key.

string.name: mtrl_picker_confirm

string.name: mtrl_picker_date_header_selected

string.name: mtrl_picker_date_header_title

string.name: mtrl_picker_invalid_format

string.name: mtrl_picker_invalid_format_use

string.name: mtrl_picker_navigate_to_year_description

string.name: mtrl_picker_out_of_range

string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_only_end_selected

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range where start date has been selected [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_only_start_selected

string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_selected

string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_title

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_unselected

string.name: mtrl_picker_save

string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_hint

string.description: Label for the start date in a range selected by the user [CHAR_LIMIT=60]

string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_day_abbr

string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_month_abbr

string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_calendar_input_mode

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button changes the input mode to a text field [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]

resources.string: Your device doesnt support enough touch points. For more information, contact your device manufacturer.
Your device doesnt support braille keyboard
The options menu is open. Flip your phone back so its facing you and hold it normally. You can now use regular TalkBack gestures to navigate. Swipe right to see more options.
Swipe up with 3 fingers for more options
Starting now, you wont be able to use regular TalkBack gestures. TalkBack isnt available while using the braille keyboard.\n\n%1$s

Your phone is in a vertical position. To continue, rotate your phone horizontally so the long side is on the bottom. Then turn the screen to face away from you. When youre ready, double tap the screen to continue.
Starting now, you wont be able to use regular TalkBack gestures. TalkBack isnt available while using the braille keyboard.
To start, hold your phone like this, with the screen facing away from you.

First, turn your phone so the screen is facing away from you.

Next, rotate the phone horizontally to landscape position. Your hands should grip the short ends of the phone. Your right hand should hold the end with the USB port. Rest your 3 middle fingers on the screen, and use your pinky and thumb to support the phone.

When youre ready, double tap the screen to continue.

To exit braille keyboard, swipe down toward the ground with 3 fingers. This switches back to your original keyboard.
Hold device with screen away from you (screen-away mode)
Each pressed dot is part of the input, even if the dot is released before other dots
Swap the dot positions, so that dots 1 and 4 trade places, for example
To hide the keyboard, swipe down with 2 fingers. Try it now.
Hide keyboard. Usually, this will hide the keyboard. The braille keyboard will stay open because youre still in the tutorial.
To switch to your other keyboard, swipe down with 3 fingers. Try it now.
Next keyboard. Usually, this will switch to the next keyboard. This time, youre staying in the braille keyboard because youre still in the tutorial.
To move the cursor forward, swipe down. Try it now.
To delete a letter, swipe left. Try it now.
To add a space, swipe right. Try it now.
You can also type in tabletop mode by placing your phone flat on a table. To finish the tutorial, swipe up with 3 fingers, and find the finish tutorial option
To move the cursor backward, swipe up. Try it now.
To change your language while typing with the braille keyboard, swipe up with 3 fingers. Then select \"switch to next language\".
Tabletop mode. Place your device with the charging port to the left. To update dot position, hold down 6 fingers.
Place device flat on a table (tabletop mode)
Turn on TalkBack to use braille keyboard
When TalkBack is on, you can tap your screen to enter braille symbols.
Resume TalkBack to use braille keyboard

With the braille keyboard, you can tap your screen to enter 6-dot braille.

Youre using Unified English Braille. To switch your typing language, go to TalkBack settings.

To type braille, you need to hold and use your phone differently.

Keep the screen faced away from you. Hold your phone in both hands, on the short edges of the phone, so that the middle 3 fingers of each hand can touch the screen.\n\nYour left index finger should be on dot 1. Now, tap dot 1 to type the letter A.
Tap dot 1 with your left index finger to type A

1. Turn on braille keyboard: Tap Settings below. On the next screen, turn on \"%1$s.\"

2. Use braille keyboard: Open your regular keyboard, then tap the choose keyboard icon %2$s (usually in the bottom right corner). Select \"%1$s.\"

If you dont see an option to switch keyboards, try installing %3$s, the Google keyboard.

To use the braille keyboard, open your regular keyboard, then tap the choose keyboard icon %1$s (usually in the bottom right corner). Select \"%2$s.\"

If you dont see an option to switch keyboards, try installing %3$s, the Google keyboard.
